question: A town in northern Arkansas experienced colder than normal temperatures during part of the winter. Which change was most likely responsible for this?
candidate_answers: (A) A southward dip in the jet stream (B) A northward movement of the jet stream (C) The Coriolis effect creating a low pressure area (D) The Coriolis effect creating a high pressure area
answer: A northward movement of the jet stream
label: B
